title: Pine Street #70

text:
70 Pine Street, (Sixty Wall Tower): west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets, showing a general view northward of the vicinity.

Pearl Street, is the thoroughfare running thru the center of these views and has the South Ferry "El" division upon the same. Across the top is the Brooklyn Bridge and its approach. In the left foreground are modern office structures housing various insurance and underwriting companies. Appearing in both views, and opposite the New York Steam Co. plant is a 35 story building, No. 1 Platt Street which is the property of the Creek Holding Corp. Note on the right, the East River and its marginal thoroughfare.

April 13, 1933
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower.]

title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower.]

text:
No. 70 Pine Street (Sixty Wall Tower); on the west side of Pearl Street; from Pine to Cedar Streets.

A general view, north from 60 Wall Street, between Pearl and William Streets, showing at the right, in the foreground, a portion of the west side of City Hall Park and Broadway, (from Mail to Chambers Streets). In the background (from left to right), the Hudson River, the Empire State Building (34th St., and 5th Ave), and the East River.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (North).]

text:
No. 70 Pine Street (Sixty Wall Tower); on the west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets.

(1) A general view, northeast from 60 Wall Street, between Pearl and William Streets, showing Pearl Street, at the extreme right.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, another view.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same, a year later and showing a closer view of Pearl Street at the right.

February 3, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

A general view, northwest from 60 Wall Street, between Pearl and William Streets, showing from left to right, the NEW Jersey Shore, the Hudson River (New York Bay) the New York Telephone (West Street, between Vesey and Barclay Streets) and the Wool-worth (233 Broadway, between Barclay Street and Park Place), Buildings.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The Same, another view. April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, a year later. February 3, 1933.

No. 70 Pine Street (Sixty Wall Tower); on the west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets.

(1)
A general view, west from 60 Wall Street, between Pearl and William Streets, showing the New York Bay, and the New Jersey Shore, with the tower of the Bank of Manhattan (main office), (40 Wall Street, north of William Street), at the left.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, from a different angle, without the Bank of Manhattan building.

July 1, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
(3) Neg. # 4083

A general view, west from 60 Wall Street, between Pearl and William Streets, showing the New Jersey Shore, the Hudson River and at the extreme left, a portion of the New York Telephone Building, (West Street, between Vesey and Barclay Streets).

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (West).]

text:
No. 70 Pine Street (Sixty Wall Tower); on the west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets.

(1)
A general view, southwest from 60 Wall Street, between Pearl and William Streets, showing the New York Bay and the New Jersey shore, with a portion of Battery Park (extreme southern part of the city) at the left.

April 13, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, four months later.

July 1, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, showing a larger portion of Battery Park (extreme southern portion of the city) with the Aquarium at the southern end of the Park.

P. L. Sperr.

(3) NEG. # 4084

title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (Southwest).]

text:
70 Pine Street, (Sixty Wall Tower): west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets, showing a general view southward towards the Upper Bay.

In the center is Battery Park and the Aquarium. Note the ships leaving and entering the North (Hudson) River. This is on the right and flows onward towards the Statue of Liberty; the State of New Jersey forming its other side. The buildings in the foreground are at the southerly tip of Manhattan and constitute a part of the business and financial district. The City Bank-Farmers 'Trust' Tower, at the left, overshadows the rectangular Produce Exchange and the U. S. Custom House. To the right is the Standard Oil structure.

April 13, 1933
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (South).]

title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (South).]

text:
70 Pine Street, (Sixty Wall Tower): west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets, showing a general view southeastward.

The prominent structures are the 24 story, No. 101 Wall Street Building and the new U. S. Assay Office. The latter is on the north side of Old Slip, between Front and South Streets. The first of these thoroughfares cuts the center of the view diagonally. Wall Street appears on the left and extends eastward from Water Street to the East River.

Spring 1933
Views 1 and 2

P. L. Sperr,
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (Southeast).]

title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (Southeast).]

text:
No. 70 Pine Street (Sixty Wall Tower); on the west side of Pearl Street; from Pine to Cedar Streets.

A general view southeastward from the 60 Wall Street Tower in Manhattan and showing across the East River, the Borough Hall section of Brooklyn with its piers No. 3 to 16. This is a set of three views from the same vantage point; No. 3 showing a portion of the Manhattan side of the river.

June 14, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (Southeast).]

text:

title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (Southeast).]

text:
No. 70 Pine Street (Sixty Wall Tower); on the west side of Pearl Street, from Pine to Cedar Streets.

A general view southeastward from the 60 Wall Street Tower and showing the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn as seen across the East River. The Bull Insular Line pier plainly seen, is pier No. 27.

June 14, 1933.

P. L. Sperr.
title: General view - [Manhattan - Between Pine and Cedar Streets - 60 Wall Street Tower (Southeast).]
